match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: West Indies won by 4 wickets (with 18 balls remaining)

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Sammy b Smith 52 (70b 3x4 1x6 86m) SR: 74.28

dismissalComment.html: gone, caught at mid-off this time! it was fuller on the off and they are now going for runs, this is hit well but cannot beat the mid-off fielder, who takes it well on his right

headshotImage.caption: Veerasammy Permaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Veerasammy Permaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sammy b Permaul 38 (58b 2x4 0x6 82m) SR: 65.51

dismissalComment.html: poor shot, gone, caught! this was on the off stump and turning away but the existence of the Powerplay overs does this to a lot of 'em, the batsman wanted to be aggressive, went for the sweep and the top-edge goes high and easy for the point fielder

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: tries to cut it away but edges it to the keeper! It was short and wide, and the shot was due but the bounce defeated him, there was a bit too much of it and Tamim fails to read that, a thin edge through to the keeper, one down after a good start

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone, two wickets in an over! He was trying to play it away to the leg side, too early to be playing that shot against a bowler of Narine's pedigree, gets a leading edge and it lobs up to the short cover region where the fielder back-pedals and takes it over his shoulder

Gone this time, lbw! It was pitched fuller and the ball turned into the batsman, tries to defend it but misses the inside edge and hits the pads, the umpire has no hesitation in raising the finger and the cat's gone off his third life!

gone, stumped off the second attempt! checking for a no-ball, and to me that looks like he had some portion behind the crease from one of the square-on cameras and quite different from the other angle...it was outside the off, beats the edge and goes for the stumping as he sees the batsman out of his crease, misses it but is alert enough to whip it off the second time round. Given out.

headshotImage.caption: Veerasammy Permaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Veerasammy Permaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone, caught at short-cover off a drive! It was on the off stump, stops on to the batsman and he fails to keep the drive down, the big frame of Pollard has to bend really low but he does that and is caught!

poor shot, gone, caught! this was on the off stump and turning away but the existence of the Powerplay overs does this to a lot of 'em, the batsman wanted to be aggressive, went for the sweep and the top-edge goes high and easy for the point fielder

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Razzak c Bravo b Sammy 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: goes for another big slog, gets a top edge and it spoons up high in the air for the short cover to get under it and take a simple catch

dismissalComment.html: slower, outside the off and smashed straight to the extra-cover fielder, caught easily

dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 126 (149b 17x4 2x6 167m) SR: 84.56

dismissalComment.html: pulled and caught! short of length and Samuels gives himself room, wants to pull it away, but the top edge goes up and straight into the hands of the fielder at square-leg!

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieran Powell st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mahmudullah 47 (59b 4x4 1x6 100m) SR: 79.66

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket and stumped! That is end of that, finally something goes right for the home team! this was from round the stumps and angling in, the batsman goes down the track to loft him over the top but misses the spin and is easily stumped by Rahim

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: so it is taking me to talk up the West Indian chances for Bangladesh to get the wickets, this was on the off stump, turning away and Smith was trying to jab it over the top, gets a bit of an outside edge that goes high but not long, the long-on fielder takes an absolute dolly!

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him, that's a ripper! no it does not turn at all, not an inch! it was a straighter one, and Pollard was playing for the turn that he would have seen all this while, sneaks it between the bat and pad and the castle is rattled!

edged and gone! Four and out! It was pitched up but it was a slower one, it gripped on the surface and despite Gayle taking his bottom hand off, it takes the outside edge through to the wicket-keeper. Rahim dives to his left to take a good catch.
pulled and caught! short of length and Samuels gives himself room, wants to pull it away, but the top edge goes up and straight into the hands of the fielder at square-leg!

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 4 (12b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: top-edge and taken! he was looking to turn that one to the leg side, hits it across the line to one that is fuller, takes a bit of a leading-cum-top edge and flies off to the backward point fielder, who takes a simple catch

headshotImage.caption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sunil Narine player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: kazim: "drop catch of samules was the turning point of this match" And probably the poor batting from the Bangladeshi middle-order?

commentTextItems.html: edged and four! that was outside the off stump, he went out to fiddle at it, got an edge and flies between the keeper and the slip, goes to the fence to win West Indies the game

commentPostTextItems.html: That is it then from me, Suneer Chowdhary, has been a pleasure bringing you this game. Will be back with the fourth ODI day after and if this was anything to go by, we can be expected to be entertained yet again.

Rahim: Difficult pitch, the set batsmen got out at the wrong time, we did not score big when the batsmen got set. Not only Mahmudullah, there were others who played well but we were 20 runs short. A ball each end helped us against the dew. Hope to come back stronger next game.

Sammy We all know how important it was to win this game. They were playing good cricket, but that knock by Marlon helped us clinch the game. Sunil Narine bowled well, we know the quality he possesses and he finally got a pitch that helped him and we saw how dangerous he is. Frittering away wickets after getting starts has been an issue for us, but Powell did a good job and Samuels got a match-winning century for us.

Samuels, man of the match Not worried at all about running out of partners, it was a good team effort from our side. Experience in crucial situations helps as well and that is where I was able to pull it. Bangladesh is playing wonderful cricket and we will look to step up the gear. Dedicate this century to my prime minister!
In the end, a win by four wickets and with three overs to spare seems like it was an easy victory but truth be told, the difference between the two teams was the one man, Marlon Samuels.

Samuels' century was one of the most calculated and matured knocks you would see on a track that a lot of purchase for the spinners. In fact, the Bangladeshi batsmen would do well to watch tapes of how he batted, they would learn a lot after they collapsed yet again to be restricted to only 227.

Kudos to the way Bangladesh fought as well, other teams may have thrown in the towel pretty early but the home side did not, and this is an attitude that will hold them in good stead for the rest of the series.

headshotImage.caption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: outside the off and he shoulders arms

commentPreTextItems.html: Saad: "I didn't escape two of my neurophysiology classes today for this.... still waiting to see some miracle to happen... pls dont give up...." To be fair, Bangladesh have really fought well today, it was a matter of an excellent innings taking it away from them.

commentTextItems.html: short of length and flicked away with typically Caribbean flair to fine-leg for a single
outside the off and fuller, defended it back to the bowler
short of length outside the off and cut away to deep point for a single

dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 126 (149b 17x4 2x6 167m) SR: 84.56

commentTextItems.html: pulled and caught! short of length and Samuels gives himself room, wants to pull it away, but the top edge goes up and straight into the hands of the fielder at square-leg!
round the stumps, and pitched up to the bat, Samuels covers the spin and drives it through for a single

headshotImage.caption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: flighted ball and it is easily drilled through the covers for a single
fuller from round the stumps and Thomas pats it to the off side
defended on the front foot and back to the bowler

commentPreTextItems.html: after Bangladesh batting order collapse, my Facebook status was, 'we'll fight back if we get passed 220'.
yes, Tigers once again showing their ability of defending a merge total.
I love to see Enamul Hq. Jr. bowling for Bangladesh on next 2 games."
They fought well but Samuels has played a real gem

commentTextItems.html: opens the face of the bat and guides it through off side for a single
driven down the ground for a single to long-off
and again, fuller, faster and it goes off the bat really quickly as well, and over the long-off fence for a six! 24 off the over takes West Indies to within 10 runs of their first win this series

headshotImage.caption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: wild swing this time, beaten but misses the stumps, goes through to the keeper

whoa, whoa whoa! Samuels has turned it on so well this over, it was pitched right up to the bat and slower, Samuels was waiting, he picks it up and smacks it over long-on for a six, game, set and match I would believe.
three in three! and is this the end of the game? it was fuller and he gives himself room and drives it through the mid-wicket region for a four!
fuller and that is two in two! drilled through the covers for a four, this has been one of the most matured innings you would see on a turning track

commentPreTextItems.html: Ken: "These so called WI one day specialists are useless, just look at Pollard, Dwayne Smith and Simmons batting averages and you will see why I say so. Keep saying that Chanderpaul is far better ODI player than many of these mediocre non-performing players, a player called Ramaresh Sarwan would have done far better than them."

commentTextItems.html: now that he has his 100, and now that the required-rate's going up, he goes for the cut, gets bit of an outside edge and rushes away to the fine third-man for a four
on the off stump, fuller and would you believe it, Thomas defends and that ends an over that has cost 'em only two!

headshotImage.caption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devon Thomas player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: just in and that is a century! driven to backward point and they are away for a single, but that is a good throw from Gazi and Rahim whips the bails away...third umpire called. Thomas was diving at the striker's end and while his bat was in when the bails came off, there is a chance that the bat was in the air at the point when the bails were removed. A very tough call one way or the other, more so given the situation of the game. Given not-out in the end to get Samuels his century.

dismissalComment.html: tries to cut it away but edges it to the keeper! It was short and wide, and the shot was due but the bounce defeated him, there was a bit too much of it and Tamim fails to read that, a thin edge through to the keeper, one down after a good start

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone, two wickets in an over! He was trying to play it away to the leg side, too early to be playing that shot against a bowler of Narine's pedigree, gets a leading edge and it lobs up to the short cover region where the fielder back-pedals and takes it over his shoulder

Gone this time, lbw! It was pitched fuller and the ball turned into the batsman, tries to defend it but misses the inside edge and hits the pads, the umpire has no hesitation in raising the finger and the cat's gone off his third life!

gone, stumped off the second attempt! checking for a no-ball, and to me that looks like he had some portion behind the crease from one of the square-on cameras and quite different from the other angle...it was outside the off, beats the edge and goes for the stumping as he sees the batsman out of his crease, misses it but is alert enough to whip it off the second time round. Given out.

headshotImage.caption: Veerasammy Permaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Veerasammy Permaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone, caught at short-cover off a drive! It was on the off stump, stops on to the batsman and he fails to keep the drive down, the big frame of Pollard has to bend really low but he does that and is caught!

poor shot, gone, caught! this was on the off stump and turning away but the existence of the Powerplay overs does this to a lot of 'em, the batsman wanted to be aggressive, went for the sweep and the top-edge goes high and easy for the point fielder

gone, caught at short-cover! This is a tame dismissal, lack of experience probably, it was on the off stump and the batsman had played out three dots earlier, he went for a lavish drive and fails to keep it down, goes straight to the short-cover fielder

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone, caught at mid-off this time! it was fuller on the off and they are now going for runs, this is hit well but cannot beat the mid-off fielder, who takes it well on his right

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi c Gayle b Sammy 30 (36b 5x4 0x6 42m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: slower, outside the off and smashed straight to the extra-cover fielder, caught easily

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 4 (12b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: edged and gone! Four and out! It was pitched up but it was a slower one, it gripped on the surface and despite Gayle taking his bottom hand off, it takes the outside edge through to the wicket-keeper. Rahim dives to his left to take a good catch.

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieran Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieran Powell st Mushfiqur Rahim b Mahmudullah 47 (59b 4x4 1x6 100m) SR: 79.66

dismissalComment.html: down the wicket and stumped! That is end of that, finally something goes right for the home team! this was from round the stumps and angling in, the batsman goes down the track to loft him over the top but misses the spin and is easily stumped by Rahim

dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 126 (149b 17x4 2x6 167m) SR: 84.56

dismissalComment.html: pulled and caught! short of length and Samuels gives himself room, wants to pull it away, but the top edge goes up and straight into the hands of the fielder at square-leg!

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sohag Gazi b Naeem Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Darren Bravo c Sohag Gazi b Naeem Islam 13 (23b 2x4 0x6 25m) SR: 56.52

dismissalComment.html: top-edge and taken! he was looking to turn that one to the leg side, hits it across the line to one that is fuller, takes a bit of a leading-cum-top edge and flies off to the backward point fielder, who takes a simple catch

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naeem Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Naeem Islam b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Dwayne Smith c Naeem Islam b Abdur Razzak 4 (12b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: so it is taking me to talk up the West Indian chances for Bangladesh to get the wickets, this was on the off stump, turning away and Smith was trying to jab it over the top, gets a bit of an outside edge that goes high but not long, the long-on fielder takes an absolute dolly!

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kieron Pollard player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kieron Pollard b Abdur Razzak 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: bowled him, that's a ripper! no it does not turn at all, not an inch! it was a straighter one, and Pollard was playing for the turn that he would have seen all this while, sneaks it between the bat and pad and the castle is rattled!

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 44 runs, 0 wicket)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 11.1 overs (67 balls), Extras 3
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 67 balls (Tamim Iqbal 21, Anamul Haque 26, Ex 3)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 78/4 in 17.1 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 5)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 20.3 overs (124 balls), Extras 16
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 30.2 overs (183 balls), Extras 20
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 68 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 20, Mahmudullah 29, Ex 4)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 14 runs, 2 wickets)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 170/6 in 38.0 overs (Mahmudullah 33, Mashrafe Mortaza 0)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 44.2 overs (267 balls), Extras 23
Mahmudullah: 50 off 67 balls (3 x 4, 1 x 6)
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 227/10 in 49.1 overs (Rubel Hossain 1)
West Indies innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 50 runs, 1 wicket)
West Indies: 50 runs in 9.6 overs (60 balls), Extras 0
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 58 balls (KOA Powell 9, MN Samuels 42, Ex 2)
MN Samuels: 50 off 53 balls (9 x 4)
Drinks: West Indies - 93/1 in 19.0 overs (KOA Powell 31, MN Samuels 51)
West Indies: 100 runs in 20.5 overs (125 balls), Extras 8
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 121 balls (KOA Powell 27, MN Samuels 61, Ex 12)
West Indies: 150 runs in 32.3 overs (195 balls), Extras 19
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 17 runs, 2 wickets)
Drinks: West Indies - 171/4 in 37.4 overs (MN Samuels 83)
MN Samuels: 100 off 140 balls (14 x 4)
West Indies: 200 runs in 44.2 overs (266 balls), Extras 20

stories.title: Bangladesh v West Indies, 2012-13
stories.subTitle: 3rd ODI
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI, Bangladesh v West Indies, 2012-13

stories.title: Samuels spoils the Bangla party
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, third ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Fan Following: Bangladesh v West Indies, third ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: When you wait seven hours for tickets, hoping to see your side clinch the series win, and the West Indian batsman ruins your plans, what do you, Jack?

image.caption: Marlon Samuels played a patient knock of 126
image.longCaption: Marlon Samuels played a patient knock of 126, Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 5, 2012

stories.title: We were short by 20-25 runs - Mahmudullah
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: We were short by 20-25 runs - Mahmudullah
stories.summary: Bangladesh's vice-captain Mahmudullah said that his team was 20 runs short of forcing a series win against West Indies

image.caption: Mahmudullah top scored for Bangladesh with 52
image.longCaption: Mahmudullah top scored for Bangladesh with 52, Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 5, 2012

stories.title: Wrong 'un helps Narine move in right direction
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wrong 'un helps Sunil Narine move in right direction
stories.summary: West Indies stayed alive in the one-day series against Bangladesh courtesy two main contributors: while Sunil Narine turned his form around with the ball in Mirpur, Marlon Samuels extended his purple patch with the bat

image.caption: Chris Gayle and his team-mates celebrate a wicket
image.longCaption: Chris Gayle and his team-mates celebrate a wicket, Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 5, 2012

image.caption: Mahmudullah top scored for Bangladesh with 52
image.longCaption: Mahmudullah top scored for Bangladesh with 52, Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 5, 2012

stories.title: Samuels, Narine help WI keep series alive
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Samuels, Narine help West Indies keep series alive
stories.summary: With the series at stake, West Indies saved face with a four-wicket win in Mirpur, set up by the spinners and a calm century by Marlon Samuels

image.caption: Marlon Samuels played a patient knock of 126
image.longCaption: Marlon Samuels played a patient knock of 126, Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, December 5, 2012

stories.title: No pressure on us - Mushfiqur
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: No pressure on us - Mushfiqur Rahim
stories.summary: The Bangladesh captain Mushfiqur Rahim has insisted his team are not feeling the pressure ahead of the third ODI in Dhaka

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim scored 79 and took three catches
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim scored 79 and took three catches, Bangladesh v West Indies, 2nd ODI, Khulna, December 2, 2012

stories.title: 'We need to be street-wise against spinners' - Gibson
stories.subTitle: West Indies in Bangladesh 2012-13
stories.seoTitle: 'We need to be street-wise against spinners' - Ottis Gibson
stories.summary: Ottis Gibson, the West Indies coach, has blamed the team's batting for the debacle in the first two matches of the ODI series

image.caption: Kieran Powell was bowled by Farhad Reza for 34
image.longCaption: Kieran Powell was bowled by Farhad Reza for 34, BCB XI v West Indians, Khulna, November 28, 2012

stories.title: Reputation at stake for West Indies
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Reputation at stake for West Indies
stories.summary: A 2-0 lead for the home side was a scenario few would have predicted last Tuesday when Bangladesh had gone down by five wickets to the BCB XI

image.caption: Darren Bravo cuts behind point
image.longCaption: Darren Bravo cuts behind point, Bangladesh v West Indies, 1st ODI, Khulna, November 30, 2012

stories.title: Wrong 'un helps Narine move in right direction
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wrong 'un helps Sunil Narine move in right direction
stories.summary: West Indies stayed alive in the one-day series against Bangladesh courtesy two main contributors: while Sunil Narine turned his form around with the ball in Mirpur, Marlon Samuels extended his purple patch with the bat

recentReportStory.title: Samuels, Narine help WI keep series alive
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v West Indies, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Samuels, Narine help West Indies keep series alive
recentReportStory.summary: With the series at stake, West Indies saved face with a four-wicket win in Mirpur, set up by the spinners and a calm century by Marlon Samuels
